New Records: The Chicago White Sox set a modern-day Major League Baseball record for most losses in a season with their 121st defeat.
Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi hit a two-run home run in the eighth inning.
Bryan Ramos hit a solo home run in the second inning.
Sean Burke pitched five scoreless innings after a 2-hour, 20-minute rain delay, allowing two hits, striking out six, and walking three.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore praised the team's effort and resilience despite the tough season.
Nicky Lopez reflected on the challenging season but emphasized the dream of playing for his hometown team.
Gavin Sheets highlighted the team's unity and professionalism through the difficult season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game on September 28, 2024, was played in front of a sellout crowd of 41,933 at Comerica Park.
The White Sox's victory over the Tigers was only their second win in 12 chances in the season series.
